caption: Perfect place to steer away from the basilica crowds in Montmartre. Needed a nice spot to chill and spend the afternoon and this google search was fruitful. Lots of benches and corners to sit and you still get a great view of the basilica. Hearing the bells in the evening was nice üîî ‚Ä¶

Amazing little park to relax at with great views of the sacre coure. Would recommend 100%to check out for the views and it is a cute photo spot.  Not very crowded as it‚Äôs linked to a little neighbourhood in the 18th. Simply lovely to spend an afternoon reading a book. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
A lovely little park, located behind the grand white church, also home to a public toilet, that is never busy, as is the gardens, the masses of tourists by pass this area.

This pretty little spot, tucked away behind the Basilica de Sacr√© Coeur, is probably missed by 99% of the tourist throngs who make their way up to the landmarks of Montmartre. And what is being missed is one of the best and prettiest public green spaces in Montmartre: Square Marcel-Bleustein-Blanchet.  The little square was once called Park Turlure, after a former windmill on the site. It was renamed Square Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet in 2004, after the French entrepreneur and advertising magnate best known as the founder of Publicis Groupe. The square is not large, and is terraced.  So why visit? It provides some of the best (and perhaps most unique) views of the Basilica de Sacr√©-Coeur. After all, few people wander around the back of the basilica, preferring to stop and photograph the ecclesiastical building face on. Further, in the spring, summer and autumn, Square Marcel-Bleustein-Blanchet is a picture of seasonal loveliness. In summer it is filled with blossoming wisteria, while in the autumn months, the autumnal yellows, golds and reds tumble over the old arbor frame, creating a canopy of autumnal loveliness. In all seasons the little park is the perfect place to enjoy a picnic, as well as a great place to stop and rest in the middle of your Montmartre walking discovery tour.  It‚Äôs not difficult to find. As you walk to the left side of the Basilica from its front facade, along Rue du Cardinal Guibert on your way to Place du Tertre, veer right (instead of turning left) along Rue du Chevalier de la Barre to the rear of the Basilica. You‚Äôll see the little square directly ahead of you. It certainly is worth a little visit and a perfect spot away from the tourist fray to rest awhile and to be still.
Amazing view of the sacr√© c≈ìur, calm, a popular and recommended area for modeling photos! Good for enjoying a moment of peace, reading some books or just having your meal in the calm.

Really nice park right next to the sacr√© coeur church. I really loved the concrete sits under the plants. There is also a water fountain for free drinking water. The only downside is the playground with all the kids that ruin the calmness of the park.
Great green park, not crowded and with a good view over the church

Absolute must place to visit while in Paris...lot of shops nearby including Indian restaurants...place is famous for fabrics aross globe starting from 10$ to 100$ per meter...Moulin Rouge is walking distance the most famous attraction of Paris....nice evening spot  Just beware of African n refugee who try to sell some religious thread...dont fall under net
Very plain park, but a nice view of the back of Sacr√© C≈ìur
Tucked away behind the basilica, a small oasis of calm. A beautiful little park that seems to be a hidden gem in such a touristy area.
Beautiful park with a great view!
It‚Äôs peaceful here and has good views to the basilica.
Best place to get a nice picture without million tourists.
Lively little park with an incredible view of the Cathedral. Great for a little sit down.
Nice place and fine architecture. A lot of individuals lurking around trying to sell or steal something.
Very nice place to have a break near Sacr√©-C≈ìur Basilica
Children's playground / playpark at the back of Sacr√©-Coeur. Very quiet and nice shady spot for kids to play in.
This garden is so cute. We stopped here to have lunch before visiting the Sacr√© Coeur. It‚Äôs small, well kept and there is a public free toilet.
Beautiful and peaceful park next to the busy square
Nice place to relax after visit to sacre coure
A small garden that is worth a visit

One of my favorite public places in Montmartre. Behind of the Sacre C≈ìur gives a fantastic view of the building. The park as different zones for resting, playing and a playground for children. A mix of all ages. Really love it üíï ‚Ä¶

Auto cleaning toilet here (free) and drinking water fountain. Nice peaceful place with much less tourists than at the front of the basilica. Overall a lovely little place to relax in your visit to Montmartre.

A nice somewhat peaceful square behind the bustling Sacr√© c≈ìur. Has benches for people to sit and enjoy the beautiful scenery and a small park on one side for kids to play in. Its a hangout for locals in the area especially over the weekend.

This is a fabulous hidden park.  Great views, places to sit and visit and a natural made jungle gym for the kids to climb and hide it when the foliage is full on the arbor tunnel.  A public restroom too.
Great park. Not so busy and you can get great picture of the basilica. Very clean.
Great park with amazing views.

I love this park. I sat next to two nuns discussing the flowers in front of us. And watched as students filmed inside the tunnel of shrubbery. This place was quaint and relaxing and forever stuck in my mind.
Lovely view and cute playground for the kids. Shaded green area has alot of bees so, if you hate them as much as I do, you might have to settle for a bench near by
Beutiful small park, out of the touristy hassle in front of the basilica
Awesome peaceful place within busy Montmartre. Sit here, read, have a snack and enjoy the view of basilica ‚ù§Ô∏è
Small garden located behind the Sacre-coeur. Great spot to take a photo of the Sacre-coeur from a less famous angle.  This park has a free to use public toilet located at the entrance.
Quiet and calm place in contrast to the touristy areas next to it, and safe from the wind :)
Has one of the auto hygienic bathrooms. No jungle gym for children. Came on a weekday where some teachers brought their preschoolers.
Get a Montmartre picture few others will have! Quiet PARC, ideal with kids or to sit down for a pique nique.
Beautiful green gem hidden a bit behind the basilica that offers you calm, relax and beautiful views.
Beautiful small park.
A calm not too crowded little park. I recommend it
